description.narrative: By 2020, children with special educational needs have improved access to quality inclusive education at pre-school and school level., which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Children With Disabilities (Covid), Data And Child Protection, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children with disabilities progressively realize their rights to education, rehabilitation and social protection and to participate in community life.

sector.narrative: Data, research, M&E, and use of evidence on children with disabilities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, children with special educational needs have improved access to quality inclusive education at pre-school and school level.

description.narrative: Using the International Classification of Functioning, Disability and Health (ICF) as an overarching framework, UNICEF continued to be engaged in the development of disability inclusive laws and policies, disability assessment/certification as well as projects focused on inclusive education. The dissemination of internationally recognized practices through training and research and cooperation with international experts honed a general agreement among professionals on the application of ICF for information documentation and exchange. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of state funds allocated from state budget to inclusive education at all levels
National disability assessment aligned with the ICF (WHO)

baseline.value: Disability assessment based on medical model

target.value: 2020:National disability assessment is fully aligned with the ICF (WHO)

actual.value: 2019:The draft of the white paper on ICF based disability assessment and certification is developed

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Inclusive Ed. - Existence of an EMIS that is inclusive of children with disabilities - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: EMIS produced some reports on enrolment of children with disabilities with focus was on medical diagnosis

target.value: 2020:EMIS provided disaggregated data on children with special education needs and disabilities is analysed and used for programming

actual.value: 2019:Software for EMIS module with data on special education needs assessment, providing disaggregation for children with disabilities is upgraded and pending testing

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Inclusive Ed. - Existence of curricula and support from teachers and school administrators that are inclusive of children with disabilities - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: Less than half of schools have access to specialists on inclusive education for consultation. No access to speech and physical therapists exists

target.value: 2020:At least 50% of schools in the country have access to curricula and support for teachers and school administrators that are inclusive

actual.value: 2019:60 trainer-mentors were capacitated for provision of support to subject matter teachers in Yerevan, Shirak and Aragatsotn secondary schools.
